text:
The scanf function reads in a string from stdin. The format string "%[^\n]\n" tells scanf to read in a string until it sees a newline character, and then to read in the newline character. The newline character is not stored in the buffer.

The scanf function returns the number of characters read in.

The scanf function will read in at most 1023 characters, because the buffer is only 1024 bytes
